description.narrative: Investment Services: IFC will offer BOA Ghana (the Bank) a suite of products namely, an equity investment up to US$ 8mn (approximately GHS 13mn equivalent) in BOA Ghana Ltd. (the Bank) for a shareholding of up to 19.9% through a private placement of new common equity shares, a Senior Loan Facility of up to US$ 10mn. The loan will be denominated in US$ with a proposed term of between 5-7 years and lastly a US$ 10mn Trade Finance Facility under the GTFP Delegated Program Authority. The Facility will guarantee trade transactions of up to 360 months.

The Project is expected to have high development impact in the following areas: (i) Improved Access to Finance: Injecting fresh capital into the Bank would allow for growth as the Bank would be able to further leverage itself to fund growth in the strategic focus area of SME and the currently unbanked rural populous. (ii) Demonstration Effect: IFC is helping to demonstrate the soundness and viability of the Ghana Banking Sector. It is expected that there will be new private sector entrants be it via new institutions or additional investment in existing enterprises, this will help to increase the reach of financial services and products in Ghana.
